intro: Lagenophora nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairless stems and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually blue or violet, and it produces small, dry fruits known as capsules. Lagenophora nudicaulis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and limestone outcrops.
